incidents.name: Increased 502 errors when accessing fly.io webiste

incident_updates.body: We have rolled out a fix and fly.io is now accessible.
We are currently investigating increased error rate when access the website and dashboard
The Machines API instance is remaining healthy.
The problematic Machines API instance is healthy again. We are continuing to monitor it.
We're investigating reports of slow responses from the Machines API in ewr.
This incident has been resolved.
We've identified an issue on some servers in CDG causing 1-200ms latency for apps and Upstash Redis requests. Our team is working on a remedy.
This incident has been resolved.
Our qro region suffered a brief network outage. Network connectivity is back to normal. We'll continue monitoring and update when we have more information.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

A new deploy has been rolled out with an apparent fix; now monitoring.
We have identified a bad commit that has disrupted some of our platform operations and are working to roll back quickly.

incidents.name: Degraded API Performance and fly.io website unavailable in some regions

incident_updates.body: We have applied a fix and are no longer seeing elevated error rates.
We have an identified an issue with a new deployment of the website and a rollback is in-progress
This incident has been resolved.
We have applied a fix and are no longer seeing elevated error rates. We are continuing to monitor API status.

We've identified the cause of the errors and have released a preliminary fix. We are seeing machines API error rates decrease. 
We are continuing to assess.
We're investigating an increase in Machines API operations like machine creations and starts/stops, affecting some apps and Fly builders.

incidents.name: Machines API incorrectly returning 200 instead of 201

incident_updates.body: A change was deployed around tracking status codes but it incorrectly handled the case where a 201 was written and then later a 200 would overwrite it. The change has been reverted back to the original/correct behavior.
GraphQL API and Dashboard are fully operational again.
We are still seeing sporadic errors and we are continuing to investigate.
GraphQL-based operations appear to be succeeding and the Dashboard is available. We are continuing to monitor for further issues.
A fix has been rolled out and we are currently monitoring.
An initial fix is being tested and we are looking to roll it out shortly.

We have identified an issue with our GraphQL API which many Fly.io services interact with. The Dashboard, Flyctl deployments and the Machines API are currently affected. Most users will will experience 503 errors when deploying from flyctl or GitHub Actions at this time.
We are continuing to investigate this issue. Users may experience intermittent 503 errors when trying to access the Dashboard or interact with services that rely on the GraphQL API (i.e Flyctl)
We are currently investigating an issue with the Fly.io dashboard where users are unable to log in

incidents.name: Upstash Redis Connectivity issues in IAD

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved.
The host has been brought back online and work is being done to restore the Upstash Redis Cluster in IAD.

Some existing Upstash Redis databases in the IAD region are still experiencing connection issues. We are continuing to work on restoring the impacted host to restore these. 
The ability to create new Upstash Redis databases in the IAD has been restored. Newly created databases are not impacted by the current issue.

We have identified the cause of the issues to a host hardware failure that is impacting the Upstash Redis cluster. We are working to restore the failed hardware.

Upstash Redis Databases with primaries in regions other than IAD are not impacted.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating customer issues connecting to Upstash Redis primaries in the IAD region

affected_components.name: Regional Availability - GRU - São Paulo, Brazil

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved. 

Some of our edges received incorrect state data for a small number of apps that used the bluegreen deploy strategy. This resulted in 502 errors when attempting to reach those apps. We identified approximately 36 apps that were impacted, including the Fly.io homepage and dashboard.

A small number of customer apps may still be seeing 502 errors due to stale state information. We are working to address this. For any apps still experiencing the error, re-deploying with `fly deploy` will correct the state information and resolve the errors.
A full fix has been implemented and we continue to monitor platform status. Impacted customer apps should be operational shortly, if they are not already.

A fix has been deployed and The Fly.io homepage, dashboard, API and metrics pages are back online and operational. A small number of customer apps may still be seeing elevated 502 errors. We are working to address this currently.
We have identified the cause of the issue and are working on a fix.
We are currently investigating elevated rates of 502 errors when accessing applications hosted on Fly.io, including the Fly.io homepage, dashboard, and fly-metrics pages.

components.name: Corrosion
components.description: Disseminates state of creation and changes of resources on our platform (e.g apps, Machines, IP addresses)

incident_updates.body: Our billing provider has resolved their incident and our systems confirm we are resolved as well.
Our billing provider has resolved their incident and our systems confirm we are resolved as well.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Due to an upstream outage, our billing system is experiencing a partial outage. Invoices may fail to load and/or be missing lines, and credits (including purchased credits) may fail to load.If you previously purchased credits and your credit balance is now showing $0.00, please be aware that this is a UI outage only - your credit balance will show the correct figure once the outage is resolved.

incidents.name: Builders are having issues being created in gru region

incident_updates.body: We have deployed a fix to the issue.

We have identified the issue and are actively working on a fix. In the meantime, you may work around by destroying your remote builder app and recreating it in another region nearby, e.g Rio de Janeiro (gig).

Identify the name of your builder app (prefixed with "fly-builder-"):
fly apps list

Destroy the builder:
fly apps destroy <builder-app-name>

Redeploy with a builder app in another region:
FLY_REMOTE_BUILDER_REGION=gig fly deploy
We are currently investigating this issue

incidents.name: Packet loss, Machines API and deployment errors in Singapore

incident_updates.body: Network metrics in SIN have returned to baseline following routing configuration updates. The issues were caused by network faults experienced by some of our upstream providers.
We have updated regional routing configuration to circumvent network faults experienced by some of our upstream providers and are continuing to monitor.
We're investigating reports of deployment failures and machines API timeouts in the `sin` region, as well as elevated packet loss which might impact deployed applications.
This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating reports of elevated WireGuard connection failures. Users may see errors while connecting over WireGuard, such as via fly ssh console.

Network connectivity has been fully restored and all services have returned to normal.

components.name: Deployments

incident_updates.body: Network is back to baseline and stable in the region.
We've added new edge hosts to FRA region and will keep monitoring the network.
We are adding more edges to the region to deal with increased traffic
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

One remaining application host had a broken cable which has now been repaired, and the region is now fully back online.
Total unavailability was 45 minutes (2024-05-13 21:00 - 21:45 UTC) for several servers in the region, and ~19 hours (2024-05-13 21:00 - 2024-05-14 15:50 UTC) for one application host.
Our datacenter provider has confirmed a network switch failure affecting a portion of hosts in this region, and is working on a resolution.
We are seeing a partial recovery of services in this region, some application hosts in this region are still unavailable.
We're investigating a network issue affecting the BOG region.
The metrics system has finished processing its backlog and the service is fully operational again.
A fix has been applied and metrics are once again being processed. They will continue be delayed until the system finishes processing the accumulated backlog.
We are currently investigating an issue affecting application metrics.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Network operations in SJC may encounter delays leading to timeouts, both for Machines operating in the region and for API requests in the region. We are working with our partners to identify the cause.

On 2024-05-08 13:20 UTC, we deployed a load-balancer update to `ams` that caused registry pushes with large image layers to get stuck, impacting new app builds from this region for ~48 hours. On 2024-05-10 12:30 UTC, this update was deployed globally, impacting new app builds for ~1 hour. We rolled back the update on 2024-05-10 13:30 UTC and the issue is now resolved.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
All services are operational and we are monitoring our telemetry.
We are repairing the last handful of physical servers.

A small percentage of physical servers have experienced abnormally high memory utilization, resulting in intermittent failures for the machines they are hosting. We are working to repair the problem and restore service to affected machines.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified an issue with generating and verifying tokens. The team is working on a fix now.
We are seeing elevated API errors. We're currently investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Most workers are back online and machines on those workers are operating. We are monitoring the final few workers to ensure they start and machines become operational.
Data center power has come back online. We are working to get all workers in sjc operational.

Some workers in sjc region are currently offline. We are working with our data center vendor to investigate the issue.

Machines that are on affected hosts in sjc are not accessible and shutdown. We recommend deploying in other regions if you are able.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
All errors have been fixed.
We've deployed another fix and are seeing signs of recovery

The iad region is still having issues, which are affecting the platform. We're investigating and will continue to update here.

Machines are not able to start. The dashboard is not loading.
We have deployed a fix to the vast majority of our hosts. We are still working on a small number of remaining hosts.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are observing elevated errors and connectivity issues across Fly.io

We experienced a temporary outage in the wireguard mesh connecting all of our physical hosts which resulted in a number of internal systems losing connectivity with each other. The mesh has been repaired, but some regions required manual intervention, notably: AMS, BOM, CDG, HKG, IAD, MIA, SJC, SYD, YYZ. The following was impacted (a non-exhaustive list, this was a full network outage): fly token validation (including github actions and flyctl auth), 6pn networking calls, log delivery, routing requests to user machines.
We have identified a small number of physical servers that are still impacted and are recovering them.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are observing elevated errors and connectivity issues across Fly.io
